items.sentence: Tom doesn\'t doubt Mary\'s ability to do the job.
Is it true that you\'re going to study in Boston?
There aren\'t any books in French in the library.
There isn\'t a scrap of food in the refrigerator.
Tom forgot to tell Mary what time he\'d be there.
Tom found Mary\'s phone number in the phone book.
I spend a few hours a day maintaining my website.
I think I can speak French well enough to get by.
Tom promised Mary that he wouldn\'t tell anybody.
There\'s no reason Tom would not want to do that.
There\'s nothing wrong with the way Tom did that.
There\'s something going on between Tom and Mary.
Do you think Tom knows where Mary studied French?
Do you think Tom really wanted to do it that way?
Do you think Tom will ever make money doing that?
Do you think Tom would be willing to sing for us?
I\'ve been living in Boston since I was thirteen.
I happen to know that Tom sold his car last week.
I have the feeling that I\'ll sleep well tonight.
Tom put his backpack on the back seat of the car.
